channel.title: Comments on: UCT MAM1000 Lecture notes part 15 – Tuesday 11th August

item.title: By: Mathemafrica - UCT MAM1000 lecture notes subject list
item.dc:creator: Mathemafrica - UCT MAM1000 lecture notes subject list
item.description: […] MAM1000 lecture notes part 15 and 16 – Combinations and permutations […]
item.content:encoded: […] MAM1000 lecture notes part 15 and 16 – Combinations and permutations […]

item.title: By: Jean-Michel Lacide
item.dc:creator: Jean-Michel Lacide
item.description: Regarding the last part of the notes, when you state that 3 ↑↑↑↑ 3 = 3 ↑↑↑↑ (3 ↑↑↑↑ 3). This would be an infinite sequence as it would continuous increase, so shouldn't it rather be 3 ↑↑↑↑ 3 = 3 ↑↑↑ (3 ↑↑↑ 3) ?
item.content:encoded: Regarding the last part of the notes, when you state that 3 ↑↑↑↑ 3 = 3 ↑↑↑↑ (3 ↑↑↑↑ 3). This would be an infinite sequence as it would continuous increase, so shouldn’t it rather be 3 ↑↑↑↑ 3 = 3 ↑↑↑ (3 ↑↑↑ 3) ?

item.title: By: Luvo Luzipho
item.dc:creator: Luvo Luzipho
item.description: In the third step of proof by induction, shouldn't it be dx (instead of dx^n) inside the brackets?
item.content:encoded: In the third step of proof by induction, shouldn’t it be dx (instead of dx^n) inside the brackets?
